name: Middle East Studies
descriptions: The Middle East Studies minor provides a comprehensive understanding of the history, religion, culture, languages, and politics of the Middle East and North Africa, enabling students to move beyond surface-level news coverage to grasp complex global issues.
The program prepares students for careers in politics, international economics, and international markets through a multi-perspective approach to studying the region.

courses: 18 hours from interdisciplinary courses focusing on the Middle East and North Africa

features: Fulfills interdisciplinary minor requirement for International Relations emphasis
